website_summaries.verdict: The HP Slate 7 strips out way too much to make its low price, and what's left can't compare to the Nexus 7's offerings.
pros: The HP Slate 7 is a durable 7-inch tablet, includes an expandable storage option, and has good gaming performance
Beats Audio effectively enhances bass-heavy music through headphones or earbuds
cons: The screen’s resolution is eye-squintingly low, large apps take a long time to load, and its cameras produce washed-out, dull-looking shots
Also, there’s no GPS, and Android 4.1.1 can feel a bit archaic compared with newer versions of the OS

customer_reviews.title: My HP touch pad was better than this turd.
customer_reviews.text: Under powered and low resolution screen. A lot of my favorite apps would work on it. (TV guide being one.) I promptly sold it on craigslist at a loss and bought a Galaxt Tab3 and have been happy ever since...although the HPTP has better sound. Save your money and skip this one...unless you get it for 20 bucks or less.
customer_reviews.author: GR G.

customer_reviews.title: for all of the bad reviews. This has happened to may many people
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for christmas for my son. It was genty used and charged but the charging port broke after 3 months. Hp knows this is a weakness in all of their slate tablets. Search on the internet. for all of the bad reviews. This has happened to may many people. They offer a replacement port for 55 usd. ridiculous. and they continue to sell this junk. I bought a dell venue 7 for my other son and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: It's a great design, but the screen looks terrible (too much ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great design, but the screen looks terrible (too much backlight, silvery sheen, bad viewing angles), and there's no auto-brightness sensor. Also the microUSB port is sensitive and I've read if you're not careful with it it breaks easily. Manufacturers need to stop competing on price and put out quality devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt recommend refurbished tablets
customer_reviews.text: Tablet just went black. Then it wouldn't charge with the provides cord.had to purchase a new tablet.
customer_reviews.author: VetMom2three

customer_reviews.title: OK,but that mini USB port still seems poor.
customer_reviews.text: I found some slight improvement in the construction of the mini usb port,which was went bad on the previous version of this tab I owned. The port was its major flaw , & I'm not confident it's been improved enough to mean much long term. Seems slightly heavier overall , but maybe that goes along with its improved,sturdier build which I like. An inexpensive tablet , but actually exceeds my admittedly low expectations. Does what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet

customer_reviews.title: Charging and start up are not working properly
customer_reviews.text: The charging is a little touchy. It would not work plugged into a apple wall charging plug, it would not charge on one of the two PC computers we had and it started up very slowly. Once I got it charged and turned on a few times it started to work ok. We are still watching it to make sure it's going to continue to work properly.

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucked. Bought three
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucked. Bought three. My two sons tablets died within a year of purchase. Wouldn't recharge. Did I mention, IT SUCKS!!!!!! (Ya, you do get what you pay for, lesson learned).

The button to turn on the device stopped working after a few months but HP was great with the return and sending out a new one.

Useless, ain't got no power ain'tt got no use

I'm very responsible for my electronic devices and try to take care of them. This was just a VERY poor design.

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi tablet unable to connect to 90% of networks I need.
customer_reviews.text: HP confirmed officially that HP Slate 7 Tablet Notebook PCs - Cannot Connect to 802.1x EAP, EAP-TLS, EAP-MS-CHAP v2, and PEAP Networks. SUPPORT COMMUNICATION - CUSTOMER ADVISORY Document ID: c03822044 Version: 1 HP Slate 7 Tablet Notebook PCs - Cannot Connect to 802.1x EAP, EAP-TLS, EAP-MS-CHAP v2, and PEAP Networks Don't buy it unless you are sure you don't want to connect to that kind of networks.. or you don't want to connect to any network at all... Expensive paperweight.

customer_reviews.title: HP Slate 2800 7-Inch 8 GB Tablet (Silver)
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this product and HP; normally if it is HP it is quality but not in this case. My largest disappointment - display was grainy. I used AnTuTu application and the resolution didn't come close to specs shown on description; I couldn't get past grainy display and so I returned the Slate. If you are looking for a 7 inch tablet I recommend the Nexus 7 or Kindle - you can't go wrong.

customer_reviews.title: excellent value, useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought it primarily to take on trips involving air travel where I do not want to lug my laptop around. I just completed my first such trip and it worked out well. Email, youtube, and photo displaying all work well with the original apps. Most web sites work good using google chrome. I need to get a few more apps to do everything that I need. Battery life seems to be pretty good.

customer_reviews.title: i got 99 pros and a con just 1

product_meta.title: HP Slate 2800 7-Inch 8 GB Tablet (Old Version)
product_meta.description:
Carry your world in the palm of your hand. Thinksmaller with an affordable HP Slate 7 that keeps yourphotos, documents, music, games, and apps with youevery step of the day. Access and manage it all on thego(8a) with a fully-featured, 7-inch diagonal tablet thatbrings everything down to size including price.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: ARM dual-core CORTEX A9 OMAP 4 1.6 GHz
8 GB Flash Memory, 1 GB RAM Memory
